description: A powerful extension of Keyv that adds tag-based cache invalidation and management capabilities.

introSections.title: Why I built Tagged Keyv Wrapper
introSections.content: @keyvhq/core is a great key-value storage library, but it lacks a native way to invalidate multiple keys based on a shared topic or category. This wrapper was built to add robust tagging support for smarter, scoped cache management.

introSections.title: What Tagged Keyv Wrapper does
introSections.content: It wraps a `@keyvhq/core` instance, allowing you to associate one or more tags with each cache entry. This enables you to perform bulk operations, such as invalidating or retrieving all entries associated with a specific tag, without affecting the rest of the cache.

introSections.title: Who benefits from Tagged Keyv Wrapper
introSections.content: Developers using the Keyv ecosystem for caching in applications that need smart, targeted invalidation, such as GraphQL APIs, content management systems, or multi-tenant platforms.

features.title: Tag-based invalidation
features.content: Organize cache entries with tags and invalidate them in bulk

features.title: Memory efficient
features.content: Automatic compaction and dead key removal

features.title: Extensible architecture
features.content: Pluggable TagManager interface for different storage backends
